glsa.title: Subversion, Serf: Multiple Vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Subversion and Serf, the worst of which could lead to execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Subversion is a version control system intended to eventually replace CVS. Like CVS, it has an optional client-server architecture (where the server can be an Apache server running mod_svn, or an ssh program as in CVSâ€™s :ext: method). In addition to supporting the features found in CVS, Subversion also provides support for moving and copying files and directories.
The serf library is a high performance C-based HTTP client library built upon the Apache Portable Runtime (APR) library.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Subversion and Serf. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details

impact.p: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, conduct a man-in-the-middle attack, obtain sensitive information, or cause a Denial of Service Condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
